alert.note: Alert for Daviess; Gibson; Knox; Pike (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 07 at 10:20AM EST until January 12 at 10:00AM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Indiana...Illinois... White River at Hazleton affecting Knox and Gibson Counties. White River at Petersburg affecting Pike, Daviess, Gibson and Knox Counties. Wabash River at Mount Carmel affecting Edwards, Posey, Wabash, White, Gibson, Knox and Gallatin Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... Illinois... Wabash River at Riverton affecting Sullivan, Knox, Crawford and Lawrence Counties. Wabash River at Hutsonville Legacy Power Plant Site affecting Sullivan, Knox, Crawford and Lawrence Counties. .Upwards of two inches of rainfall this past weekend put several rivers across central Indiana into flood. Minor flooding is expected to continue on the lower Wabash River through this weekend...and on the lower White River through early next week. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...White River at Petersburg. * WHEN...Until late Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 19.0 feet, Low bottomlands flood and flooding begins on higher bottomlands. State Road 257 may begin to flood if Shoals gage reading is over 17 feet. Private levees may be overtopped in many cases. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 AM EST Friday /8:30 AM CST Friday/ the stage was 18.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:30 AM EST Friday /8:30 AM CST Friday/ was 19.5 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall to 17.1 feet and then begin rising early Monday morning. It will then rise again to 17.2 feet Monday morning. It will fall to 17.1 feet and then begin rising early Monday afternoon. It will then rise again to 17.2 feet early Tuesday morning. It will fall below flood stage late Tuesday evening. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. The next statement should be issued this evening by around 915 PM CST /1015 PM EST/.
